physical_examinations.vital_signs: Cortisol: extremely low; ACTH: extremely low; TSH: mildly elevated
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Diagnosis of hypoglycemia, convulsions, and reduced size of adrenal glands in the male patient from Ljubljana; generalized convulsions in the male patient from Heerlen after the second day of life; red hair and pale skin observed in all patients.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: In the two patients, hair color changed to brown in the second and third year of life.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mild delay in motor skills likely explained by obesity; hyperphagic behavior reported from the first month of life.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: In the male patient, BMI-SDS subsequently declined even without therapy, indicating a reduced weight gain rate as he grew.
